Articles.Content:
My install crashes very frequently whenever I enter the VAB. The crash sometimes takes a couple of enter/exit cycles to happen, usually 2 or 3.  After updating all the mods that had updates, the crashed became more frequent, and took only 2 cycles. The crash specifically happens during the loading screen.

Reproduction steps: load into a save; {enter the VAB; exit the VAB;} repeat until the crash happens

Also the crash doesn't seem to produce a log, or at least it's not produced in the place it's supposed to.

Mod list:

Computer specifications:

CPU: Ryzen 5 1600

RAM: 16GB

GPU: GTX  1070ti

The game is also installed on a SSD

This sounds a lot like what I'm experiencing right now, funnily enough I didn't get this on Windows, but using a very similar mod setup to you (namely RP1 and scansat) on Linux started crashing me probably 90% of the time I went through any load screen, upon some random reading and chance I took off scansat and my crashes basically went away, again this isn't a problem I had on Windows but it is one that manifests its self under Linux for me, chances are you're on Windows so it might not be the exact same thing, but the symptoms are exactly the same - sometimes loading fine but very often crashing during/at the end of loads, nothing in logs just an abrupt  end, my current 'solution' is just to play without scansat but I'm hoping to figure something out to keep it going...

 

edit: turns out, this setup uses a literally incredible amount of ram, my game got a lot more stable without scansat once I added 8gb of swap (ontop of 16gb ram) and when turning scansat back on it uses an incredible 3.5gb of my swap on top of almost filling out my ram, so, my #1 suggestion would be to check your ram and make sure you have windows page file enabled on windows, or a swap space/file on linux, it may use less memory generally on windows (I haven't checked) but this RP1+scansat setup seems to require a lot of ram

 

Edited January 16, 2022 by smt
adding additional info
